Context:
Program Name: Business Administration
Code: B155
Credential: Ontario College Advanced Diploma
Method of Study: Full-time
Duration: 3 years (6 semesters in-class, 2 semesters work experience)
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $3,798.00 *
International Tuition: $17,925.00 **
Location: St. James Campus
Experiential Learning: Work Experience (Co-op or Internship) Required
Program Overview: The Business Administration (with work experience) advanced diploma program provides students with a wide range of options for their career in the business world. The combination of in-class learning and on-the-job experience will give students the knowledge to work in different team settings and even lead projects.
Skills gained after completion:
- Conduct and present research to help make important business decisions
- Utilize the latest trends and technologies in business to support a company’s goals
- Develop a business plan that outlines the objectives and strategies of a business.

* Domestic tuition fee for one academic year
** International tuition fee for one academic year.

Context: The Centre for Business at George Brown College offers a Business Administration program (B155) under the School of Management. This program is accredited by the Accreditation Council for Business Schools and Programs (ACBSP), and students are required to complete two semesters of work experience, either co-op or internship, to graduate. The Centre for Business has earned international recognition with fourteen programs receiving ACBSP accreditation. In 2019-2020, the graduate employment rate was 78% and graduate satisfaction rate was 82%. In the 2020-2021 academic year, the graduate employment rate was 60% and graduate satisfaction rate was 79%. George Brown works with employers and industry partners to identify work experience opportunities and encourages students to pursue self-directed opportunities. Graduates of the Business Administration program are prepared for various administrative and management positions in diverse employment settings.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Business Administration Program (with work experience) B155 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
To graduate from the B155 program, you need to complete a total of 37 courses: 28 mandatory courses, 6 Business electives, 3 General Education electives, and 2 Work Experience Terms. The Work Experience term can be in the form of co-op, internship, simulation, consulting or research projects. Depending on the results of placement tests, you may be required to take COMM 1000 (Introduction to College Communication) and MATH 1027 (Business Math with Remediation) before progressing to other courses. These two courses do not count toward the 36 courses required for graduation and will be charged extra.

You must complete three General Education courses from at least two of the following categories: Social Sciences (GSSC), Arts and Humanities (GHUM), or Science and Technology (GSCI). You are required to make up any failed or dropped courses before graduation. Some Continuing Education courses may be taken to make up these classes, but it is important to check with the business office staff to ensure equivalence to what is taught in the full-time program.

Semester 1 required courses include BUS 1038 (Business Concepts I), COMM 2000 (Communicating Across Contexts), COMP 1010 (Business Computer Applications I), HRM 1008 (Fundamentals of HR Management), MARK 1020 (Principles of Marketing I), and MATH 1008 (Math for Business & Management I). No pre-requisites are listed.

Context:
Business Electives offered during semesters 5 and 6 at the college include:

1. CMMK 1114 - Business Research & Report Writing
2. COMM 1034 - Communication 1
3. COMP 1113 - Principles of E-Business
4. HRM 2027 - Coaching for Effective Performance Management (by interview only)
5. MARK 2053 - Negotiation Skills
6. MGMT 2037 - Retail Management
7. MGMT 2041 - International Trade Management
8. MATH 1138 - Retail Math
9. MGMT 1034 - Retail Marketing
10. MARK 1020 - Marketing
11. MGMT 3013 - Shopper Research
12. HRM 2030 - Field-Based Advanced Coaching (HRM 2027 by interview only)
13. BUS 1038 - International Sales and Marketing
14. MGMT 2029 - International Market Entry Strategies
15. MGMT 2049 & BUS 1044 - Procurement
16. MARK 1002 - Marketing I
17. MGMT 2042 - International Sales and Marketing

Program Learning Outcomes:
The graduate will be able to:
1. Evaluate the impact of global issues on an organization’s business opportunities by using an environmental scan.
2. Apply principles of corporate sustainability, corporate social responsibility and ethics to support an organization’s business initiatives.
3. Assess and use current concepts/systems and technologies to support an organization's business initiatives.
4. Conduct and present research to support business decision making.
5. Plan, implement and evaluate projects by applying project management principles.
6. Perform work in compliance with relevant statutes, regulations and business practices.
7. Apply human resource practices to support management objectives and the organization’s goals.
8. Use accounting and financial principles to support the management and operations of an organization.
9. Assess marketing and sales concepts and strategies and apply them to the needs of an organization.
10. Outline principles of supply chain management and operations management and assess their impact on the operations of an organization.
11. Participate in the development of a business plan.
12. Develop strategies for ongoing personal and professional development to enhance work performance in the business field.
13. Outline strategies used to manage risks in an organization's business activities.

Tuition & Fees:
Domestic Tuition: $3,798.00 * †
International Tuition (not provided)

Context:
* Domestic tuition for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2023 is $3,798.00.
* International tuition for the first two semester of programs starting in Fall 2023 is $17,925.00.
* Domestic tuition for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2024 is not provided.
* International tuition for the first two semester of programs starting in Fall 2024 is not provided.
* Tuition fees are subject to board approval.
* Material, student service and ancillary fees are estimated but subject to change.
* There is an additional fee of $500 for each work experience semester.
* This program includes two work experience semesters.
* International Students should visit the "International Fees and Related Costs" page for more information.
* This program is approved for OSAP funding, provided the applicant meets OSAP eligibility criteria.
* Applicants are selected based on academic achievement, including required courses and any other selection criteria outlined.
* Ontario Secondary School Diploma or equivalent is required.
* Grade 12 English (C or U) and grade 11 Math (C, M or U) or grade 12 (C or U) are required.
* Mature students may take the Admissions Assessment for English and Math or consider upgrading to achieve the credit(s) needed in English and Math.
* George Brown College fee requirements should be verified by students.

Context:
The text provides information on various aspects of applying to a program at George Brown College. Here is the extracted information:

1. Some college and university credits may qualify for exemptions. For more information, visit the transfer guide.
2. English proficiency is necessary for success in the program. Review the English proficiency requirements.
3. International students should visit the International Admissions page for country-specific admission requirements.
4. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges. International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
5. Information sessions are held on a regular basis. Sign up for an upcoming session.
6. For inquiries about domestic admissions, contact the Admissions Office at admissions@georgebrown.ca or visit the Admissions section.
7. International students can contact international recruitment representatives by booking a virtual meeting or submitting an inquiry. Visit the International Contact Us page for more information.
8. For financial aid inquiries, contact the Financial Aid Office at FinAid@georgebrown.ca or visit the Financial Aid section.
9. To get advice on program options and which program might be best suited, make an appointment to see an Entry Advisor. Review these frequently asked questions.
10. For inquiries related to programs at the Centre for Business or additional information, contact the Centre for Business at business@georgebrown.ca, phone: (416) 415-5000 ext. 2160.
11. For program-specific inquiries, please contact the co-ordinator of the Business Administration program.
